full_text: as Boe eee DleRaxrt IN THE HIGH COURT OF KERALA AT ERNAKULAM 2019/KER/S PRESENT THE HONOURABLE MR. JUSTICE K.ABRAHAM MATHEW THURSDAY, THE 03RD DAY OF JANUARY 2019 / 13TH POUSHA, 1940 Cri.MC.No. 16 of 2019 AGAINST CC 165/2017 of J.M.F.C., KASARAGOD CRIME NO. 1057/2016 of Kasaragod Police Station, Kasaragod PETITIONER: SIDDIQUE K.K., AGED 33 YEARS S/O.MUHAMMED, CHERANGAI KADAPPURAM, KUDLU P.O., KUDLU VILLAGE, KASARAGOD. BY ADV. S.JIJI, RESPONDENTS : 1 STATE OF KERALA, REPRESENTED BY PUBLIC PROSECUTOR, HIGH COURT OF KERALA, ERNAKULAM - 682 031. 2 HARIF @ ARIF AGED 39 YEARS S/O.MUHAMMED, HITACHI QUARTERS, ALAMPADY POST, KALLAKKTTA, KASARAGOD - 671 541. BY ADV. SMT.K.S.SANTHI SRI C S HRITHWIK-PUBLIC PROSECUTOR THIS CRIMINAL MISC. CASE HAVING BEEN FINALLY HEARD ON 03.01.2019, THE COURT ON THE SAME DAY PASSED THE FOLLOWING: Crl.MC.No. 16 of 2019 2 201KERIS ORDER Petition filed under Section 482 Cr.P.C. 2. Petitioner is the accused in C.C.No.165 of 2017 on the file of the Judicial Magistrate of First Class-I, Kasaragod. He is alleged to have committed the offences under Sections 324 and 341 IPC. Second respondent is the victim. It is submitted that the matter has been settled and the proceedings in the trial court may be quashed. 3. Heard the learned counsel for _ the petitioner and second respondent and the learned Public Prosecutor. 4. I have perused the affidavit filed by the second respondent, who has entered appearance through counsel. I am satisfied that the matter has been settled and no public interest is involved in this case. There is no impediment for granting the prayer of the petitioner. Crl.MC.No. 16 of 2019 3 2019/KERIS In the result, this Crl.M.C. is allowed. The proceedings in C.C.No.165 of 2017 on the file of the Judicial Magistrate of First Class-I, Kasaragod are quashed. If any material objects have been produced in this case, the trial court may pass appropriate orders for their disposal. Sd/- K.
